column2: 1. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 2. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column10: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 7. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column6: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 9. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 10. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column4: has no effect on either judgement or driving  ability.
column6: harms both judgement and driving skills.
column8: has no effect on driving ability but affects your judgement.
column10: improves driving skills but affects your judgement.

column2: 15. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 16. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 18. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 19. Drivers can use drugs while driving only if:
column4: they have been prescribed by your doctor.
column6: they don't contain any controlled substances.

column2: 20. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
